dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, uh, did you see this? Netflix reported a catastrophic loss of 12 million subscribers? In one quarter?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, uh, did you see this? Netflix reported a catastrophic loss of twelve million subscribers? In one quarter?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, I saw that. It's, um, pretty wild, right? Like, that's a huge number for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no, I saw that. It's, um, pretty wild, right? Like, that's a huge number for them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wild? It's just... so bad. How do they even, like, function?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild? It's just... so bad. How do they even, like, function?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, their stock did, uh, plummet two hundred dollars a share after that report. And, um, insiders apparently sold off before the crash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, their stock did, uh, plummet two hundred dollars a share after that report. And, um, insiders apparently sold off before the crash.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, of course they did. Always. So, this whole, like, streaming empire, it's just, what, falling apart?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, of course they did. Always. So, this whole, like, streaming empire, it's just, what, falling apart?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But, um, it's serious! Hastings, the CEO, he's saying competitors like Disney and Apple are gonna put them out of business. Quickly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, um, it's serious! Hastings, the C E O, he's saying competitors like Disney and Apple are gonna put them out of business. Quickly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He also thinks there's "zero appetite for great movies" and people "loathe anything delivered online." He runs an online streaming service! What is he even talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He also thinks there's zero appetite for great movies and people loathe anything delivered online. He runs an online streaming service! What is he even talking about?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, I know it sounds contradictory. But he's also, um, admitting their original content is a "huge waste of money."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, I know it sounds contradictory. But he's also, um, admitting their original content is a huge waste of money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the face of mounting competition, Hastings touted the strength of Netflix's original content.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Like "The Umbrella Academy" that's "universally panned" and watched by a million people. Or "Triple Frontier" where 100 homes "refused to watch." Riveting stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Like The Umbrella Academy that's universally panned and watched by a million people. Or Triple Frontier where one hundred homes refused to watch. Riveting stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said. Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they're pulling popular shows internationally, too. Like "Nailed It!" in Mexico, because it was, um, "awful."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're pulling popular shows internationally, too. Like Nailed It! in Mexico, because it was, um, awful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is adapting its lighthearted cooking competition Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany and Spain. ¡Nailed It!: México has achieved three times more first-month watchers in Mexico than the dubbed US version, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because it was awful. So, their strategy is just to, like, make awful content and then pull it? That's the plan?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because it was awful. So, their strategy is just to, like, make awful content and then pull it? That's the plan?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ted Sarandos, the Chief Content Officer, says "increasingly our business is about making and telling awful stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ted Sarandos, the Chief Content Officer, says increasingly our business is about making and telling awful stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos. So increasingly our business is about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. Okay. So, the biggest streaming service is, uh, actively trying to destroy itself with terrible content and, like, admits it. Sounds about right for, you know, everything else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. Okay. So, the biggest streaming service is, uh, actively trying to destroy itself with terrible content and, like, admits it. Sounds about right for, you know, everything else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But, um, it really does signal, though, a major shift, right? For the industry? The future of streaming?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, um, it really does signal, though, a major shift, right? For the industry? The future of streaming?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, like, the end of it. Who cares, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, like, the end of it. Who cares, honestly.
